name: gnome
content:

an imaginary, very small, old man with a beard and a pointed hat, in traditional children's stories
a model of a gnome used as a garden decoration: garden gnome I don't think garden gnomes are in very good taste.
Mac99/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
US a person who works by using their mind, but does not talk to, and is not known by, the public: The gnomes in the back room are putting the finishing touches to the new software. the gnomes of Zurich UK disapproving
the powerful bankers (= people who own or control banks) from Switzerland who control a lot of money, much of it belonging to foreign governments: He had, perhaps unfairly, blamed the gnomes of Zurich for the sterling crisis.
